website_summaries.verdict: Effectively two label printers in one, the DYMO LabelWriter 450 Twin Turbo can hold rolls of, say, address and stamp labels, so you can easily print on either one.
pros: Holds two label rolls for easy switching between label types or sizes
cons: Twice the footprint of typical label printers that hold only one roll

customer_reviews.title: so good I bought a second one...
customer_reviews.text: Not too keen on the software but I do like the simplicity and clean thermal printing if these machines...this is my second one!
customer_reviews.author: Gillian at Ardunan

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased to have the two different labels and to choose between according to the application.
customer_reviews.author: Mr O.

customer_reviews.title: Great wee printer
customer_reviews.text: This is my first experience with Dymo and it's a great wee printer, perfectly suits the task required. We didn't want the hassle of Laser printer with toner worries and awkward set-ups. The two label sizes we use are easily loaded and, thanks to the dual label feeds, are always available. The accompanying software makes it a simple task to type out and print to the correct size.
customer_reviews.author: Peter M

customer_reviews.title: Hassle free
customer_reviews.text: It's a lovely time specially for two different sizes labels . Dymo is hassle free
customer_reviews.author: S K

customer_reviews.title: The almost perfect label printer.
customer_reviews.text: I now have three of these in different locations. These are the best all-around label printers for quick and easy printing of shipping labels. If only Amazon would allow Dymo software to integrate with their FBA system! These printers are easy to use, take a variety of different label sizes, and are fairly quiet whilst print quickly and accurately. Labels are cheap if you don't mind buying generic company brands. Just don't drop them as they are not very robust.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Not so keen at first but it does the Job
customer_reviews.text: When I initially started using the product, I found that some letters were missing but I think this is due to the glue around the labels when it was sealed. A few labels later, the labels come out in a jiffy, no waiting around and no fuss. It is really useful for quick and efficient postage labels.
customer_reviews.author: Mizz_Chilli

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, service & delivery
customer_reviews.text: First class all round, ideal for my needs, perfect for different coloured labels for my family history file sleeves and boxes
customer_reviews.author: Mr. P. L. Eddy

customer_reviews.title: Dymo Dynamo Label Writer
customer_reviews.text: Recently Purchased the twin Turbo Labeller. Fantastic Product had my reservation about the thermal ink process magnificent quality print out, selection of fonts and labelling utilities, so easy to use, Dymo definitely got it right, this is the future of modern printing,. going to do a second review after I have used the print labeller a lot longer.
customer_reviews.author: GeorgeR

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use label printer
customer_reviews.text: This is a very easy to use label printer just download the software from their site and it will give you the option to use dymo software or in word. Type what you want, select your font etc and print. Its very easy. I have only used it for normal size labels.
customer_reviews.author: amazon6544

customer_reviews.title: VERY VERY pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this twin label printer. Using 99014 (101x54mm) as address/shipping labels and smaller 11355 (51x19mm) for general use. Software is easy to use, integrates well with MS Outlook and it keeps a) recently used label types b) saved labels for daily re-use c) recently printed labels. Easy to clean and overall the product is well built and easy to use. Pressing the button at the front feeds 1 label, if you want to write on them rather than printing. The one and only downside is: This device does not have an on/off switch.
customer_reviews.author: R VORWERK

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a great item for a small office, it is fast clean and does the job perfectly
customer_reviews.author: Alanj49

customer_reviews.title: Best labeller on the market
customer_reviews.text: Fine, the second one I have had after my single one packed up following 6 years hard labour. Nice to have choice of label sizes.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Brunskill

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The best printer in the whole world for printing labels.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution
customer_reviews.text: A perfect solution to our labeling needs, very easy to set up and use.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Wilkes

customer_reviews.title: DYMO LABEL WRITER
customer_reviews.text: What a great machine, Prints perfectly and love the way you can edit label template. Add images and copy n paste. Great product! Garrisonlocks
customer_reviews.author: Richard Breslin

customer_reviews.title: Overall good quality and very handy
customer_reviews.text: overral good quality and very handy, you can use two different type of labels at the same time and the machine will memorise the size setting automatically. There is an annoying hiccup with the machine though, it will hang up time to time not responding to the printing command - you will have to disconnect the power lead, wait for the matchin itself power down (hear the USB diconnection beep from the computer) and then put the power lead back on, and it will then print the last job again. But overall, it runs well.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Great label printer.
customer_reviews.text: I love having a label maker. I had a Dymo that only printed one label so I didn't have the option I have with this Dymo of loading 2 different size labels and printing which I needed. When you only have one, you either are reinserting different label sizes or sticking with one size label. And when you load labels, you wind up losing one as it loads, very wasteful. This way I can load address size labels on one side and package mailing labels on the other. I love it - so easy to use and the labels look great!
customer_reviews.author: Akitalady

customer_reviews.title: SMEARS and DESTROYS Postage
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking it would save me time and money on postage for my small business. I spent hours trying to get the labels to print. Constantly having to delete and re-add the Dymo printer and then the postage. I had to wait for backup postage as the machine DESTROYED the roll I got with the purchase. Now today, every 2nd or 3rd postage is smearing beyond use and that’s money just being flushed away. I cannot believe this. I bought this because it was highly recommended by a friend. What a terrible mistake. And YES. I only used Dymo products. Yes, I followed instructions. Yes, I’m insanely furious right now.
customer_reviews.author: Carla Marie Sidhom

customer_reviews.title: Postage Service Is NOT FREE as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Based off the information listed the Postage no monthly fee is false advertising. I purchased this product thinking I could cancel my Stamps.com account and just use this. I was wrong. Maybe I'm missing something. This is completely false advertising to the product. I would return it. However, my wife tossed the box. Eliminate the waste and hassle of sheet labels Print precise quantities without difficulty. Print USPS approved DYMO Stamps postage directly from your desktop no monthly fee, contracts or commitments required
customer_reviews.author: Chris E.

customer_reviews.title: I like having different label sizes available.
customer_reviews.text: I have a LavelWriter 4XL, which is a very versatile printer. I just didn't like changing labels all the time. For that reason, I bought a LavelWriter 450 Twin Turbo. I have no complaints whatsoever with this or my 4XL. Dymo's software is pretty buggy, but the printers work perfectly. It is REALLY NICE to have the 2 extra labels already loaded, and ready to print. I always wasted a label when changing labels, as I didn't want to continually open the print head. Now I can change from my computer all I want. The printers are great! Dymo's software needs some work.
customer_reviews.author: drjim

customer_reviews.title: Expen$ive mistake, Little formatting control, designed to be $$$ in supply usage
customer_reviews.text: This is the most cynical implementation of a printer because it's only function is to consume supplies as quickly and unapologetically as possible. There is no label making software, despite what the advertising says, to work with Mac OSX. While you can print from mac... eventually ... all QR codes or texts end-up half of whatever the approximate size of the label being used. You can jury rig this to work in MS Word, but it is painful, tedious and a manual process. The add-ins that attempt to map their proprietary label part #'s doesn't work and it doesn't print bar codes direct except via Word. Stick to Avery sheet labels and a laser printer.
customer_reviews.author: Vic

customer_reviews.title: Software is impossible.  Stops work and then the machine is useless.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this unit for 8 months. It stopped working. A software upgrade deletes all your custom templates that you created. Then, no matter what, the printer stays "offline". The lights show that it is there but it is not available for printing. You cannot add another printer driver as it says it is there. But when you try and use it; it is not! There are no error messages. There is no help. Unplugging and replugging does not work. The software is completely unintuitive. Custom files are buried deep within a hidden library. There is no option but to throw the machine away.
customer_reviews.author: Experienced

customer_reviews.title: Constantly disconnects from PC/Windows
customer_reviews.text: Supposedly this problem is fixed (according to the vendor) but I bought this in April 2019 and I can assure you it is not fixed. I have tried multiple times to uninstall the old software and reinstall the new software. Sometimes it works and sometimes it does not. The label printer itself, when it is working, does a great job. But I advise potential purchasers to hold off until they can get their technical people to solve this problem.. A few weeks later .... same problem. Extremely irritating. DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Legacy label and stamp printer
customer_reviews.text: My first twin turbo ran for 12 years. Unfortunately, a severe jam, even after clearing and cleaning as per tech support (which is great), resulted in that side no longer syncing label roll advance; it overshot, wasting any type label/stamp roll tested. So my Twin became a Single, and I replaced it. Unlike the first, this new machine has given me a few hiccups along the way; losing connection even tho plugged in. But it's working reliably now and overall it's just a great tool for stamps and shipping labels for my independent author/publisher book-mailing needs.
customer_reviews.author: Bart Windrum

customer_reviews.title: Actively Lowers the Cost of Health Care in the Direct Primary Care model
customer_reviews.text: We run a Family Medicine office in Southwest Detroit called Plum Health DPC and our trusty DYMO hasn't let us down so far in our 2+ year run of delivering affordable and accessible health care. With our trusty DYMO at our side, we can easily dispense wholesale medications at unbelievable prices for our patients here in Detroit. Without our DYMO, I don't even think building a business that actively lowers the cost of health care would be possible. Thank you DYMO printer, we love thee so! - Dr. Paul Thomas with Plum Health
customer_reviews.author: Paul C Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Dymo and stamp labler
customer_reviews.text: This is my second machine and I love these. they are easy to use and setup, I bought this one for a club I belong to, because, they kept running to post office for stamps. Everyone loves being able to print out labels and stamps This saves us many hours of having to use avery labels that loose their effective adhesive over timel
customer_reviews.author: Gloria April

customer_reviews.title: Not QuickBooks compatible. Native software is trash.
customer_reviews.text: This product is NOT compatible with QuickBooks POS 18. It is not listed on their compatible printer last, and does not print labels correctly (see my label, printed sideways). We only got it to even print that after two hours of messing around, trying to install it. The Dymo software itself doesn't print at all, but produces some cryptic error which indicates a software code bug. This product is utter garbage. Very disappointed. Planning on returning it unless by some miracle it works in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: Erika S.

customer_reviews.title: Remember to check for software updates if you are using a Mac with OS X El Capitan
customer_reviews.text: As the happy and contented owner of an earlier model, a Label Writer 400 that finally gave up after several years of stalwart duty, I decided to upgrade to the 450 Twin Turbo. I experience peculiar problems with the machine failing to print and it tok a little research to discover that the software needed an upgrade to work effectively with Mac OS 10 El Capitan. It now works perfectly and I am once again happy as a clam
customer_reviews.author: David Sapire

customer_reviews.title: Fills all my label requirements
customer_reviews.text: The DYMO Label Writer 450 Twin Turbo label printer allows me to print all the different label sizes I need. The software is very easy to use and it's versatile. It's easy to switch between the two label sizes I routinely use. Print quality is great. No more guessing what's in a folder, bin, or box. They're all clearly labeled now. And, if I need a different label type/size, it's easy to switch from one roll to another. This label printer has definitely helped me stay organized. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: WORST PURCHASE  EVER!
customer_reviews.text: My DYMO 450 Twin Turbo is pure trash! I purchased it for a small home business in NOV. 2018. Wish I would have known what a disaster this product would turn into before the return date expired. A heck of a lot of money spent for a piece of garbage that spits out too many labels or mostly REFUSES to print labels no matter what you try. I have Windows 10 and tried it on other operating systems so that is not the problem-this is just a moody piece of crap that decides what day it might want to work which is 99% "NO" not today, everyday!
customer_reviews.author: VannaBlack

customer_reviews.title: Label Application is Horrible!
customer_reviews.text: Label Application is Horrible! Must have been written years ago. I got my Brother QL-570 back out to use because the application is so superior. The DYMO Label Writer 450 Twin Turbo label printer is crippled due to their sub-par Label Application. Look to Brother... as a label printer is only as good as the software that supports it.
customer_reviews.author: drol343

customer_reviews.title: Works GREAT for sending FOIA requests!
customer_reviews.text: Works GREAT for sending FOIA requests to ALL of the Intelligence agencies ONLY for them to ACT like they KNOW NOTHING about reconnaissance satellites and MY BRAIN SIGNATURE! I guess it just ANOTHER pay-for-play satellite surveillance warrant and NOTHING will EVER get DONE about it! However, this is an EXCELLENT thermal printer for SENDING the FOIA requests and ANYTHING ELSE you need to mail or ship!
customer_reviews.author: Chris A. Krusey

customer_reviews.title: Excellent address and barcode printer.
customer_reviews.text: I use the DYMO twin turbo thermal printer to print address labels and barcodes. I find that this printer does a fantastic job with no smears or misprinted labels. Loading labels into the printer is very simple and straightforward. Anyone looking for a printer for printing address labels barcodes and even postage cannot go wrong by purchasing this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy L Williams

customer_reviews.title: fine label printer
customer_reviews.text: These Dymo label printers are great. One concern though: I wish Dymo would make a network label printer. You could share this printer on your PC, but in my experience that arrangement is unstable, particularly if your coworkers are using PCs with different OSes. One solution that works well for me is the TP Link TL-PS110U, which essentially converts a USB printer into a network printer. I don't know if this printer is on the hardware compatibility list for the TP Link unit, but I've been using the setup for over a year and it's very stable.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Byrne

customer_reviews.title: Printing Postage requires $15 a month subscription
customer_reviews.text: Prints nice and fast, USB connection only. No off switch. It'd be nice if it had network connectivity. Printing postage is going to cost you $15 per month for the service, and there is no discount on the postage either. Not all the postage types were available, like padded envelope. Great label printer.
customer_reviews.author: Park Manager

customer_reviews.title: A workhorse
customer_reviews.text: 2 stars off "Easy to Use" only because the Dymo Connect program takes time to get the hang of and it is rather rudimentary. Once you figure it out and what it can & can't do your good. The machine itself works well. Easy to load, prints very well and the results are professional looking. Have run multiple rolls of labels through with no problem - Dymo and Non-Dymo. My worst problem is forgetting to switch the side when I click to print. Wasted a lot of labels using the wrong carriage. My bad. Otherwise it is a valuable tool at work and I'm happy I chose it.
customer_reviews.author: Al Parrish

customer_reviews.title: DYMO - Awesome Label/Postage printing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my 15 year old Seiko Label Printer mdl: 200... hmm sad to see it go but am completely satisfied with this printer. It does everything and more than my old one. Absolutely LOVE the free stamp program via Endicia! No more monthly Stamps.com payments! Just add funds to your account when you need to print postage. It works flawlessly with the stamps.com digital scale I have too! Very easy to setup, the included software works well and has a lot of options to print images and different fonts etc. The biggest plus is that it has two printers in one unit, I use one dedicated to postage and one for labels.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Saves time, works great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit and the coordinating papers for my 16 year old son who started an online business. I literally didn't have to do anything to help him set this unit up and he had it working in a few minutes. He has professional looking mailing labels and return address labels with his business name on them and uses this unit daily. If a 16 year old can do it on his own i imagine almost anyone can. No complaints at all! It was also perfectly packed and arrived without a scratch. A great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: LRRE

customer_reviews.title: Good printer overall but not for everyone
customer_reviews.text: PROS: - Prints two sizes of labels simultaneously - Fast - Sleek profile CONS: - Software is bloated - Not super intuitive to use - Labels can be expensive, can't use the free labels from UPS etc I like my Rollo printer better, but this is still useful for other sizes.
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: Only reason why I am not giving this a 5 ...
customer_reviews.text: Only reason why I am not giving this a 5 stars is because I purchased this to make my shipping process faster. Well not quite, There are two different applications you need to use in order to print a shipping label and a stamp. You need to ship anything over 13oz via 1st class, forget it. Also, I have a stamps.com account and the DYMO stamps that comes with it or even the new roll you buy #30915 will not work with them. I was trying to save myself some money by buying this one. I'm returning it and buying the DYMO 4XL.
customer_reviews.author: Flor

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth The Money!
customer_reviews.text: I had to return this after being on the phone with Amazon Tech Support for and hour. Every time I thought it was working, the next time I printed a label it would reel off 10 labels so fast it fed them back into itself and I had to “unjam” it. I may have gotten a dud, but I’m not going to order another one for sure!
customer_reviews.author: K.Montana

customer_reviews.title: They used to be great
customer_reviews.text: Dymo IS a mess! Software BUGGY! I can't print out of Outlook GRRRRRRRRRRRRR! I had to buy Ethernet print server devices just to get Dymo Printers... Label makers to Mount in Windows 10. HOURS of my time wasted debugging Dymo label makers. I unfortunately own DYMO Label Writer Twin Turbo 450 Label Printers DYMO Label Writer Twin Turbo Label Printers.
customer_reviews.author: wantwhatwhy

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last as long as expected
customer_reviews.text: Used this for labeling folders, envelopes, etc in our office. This one only lasted about 1 1/2 yrs, while others we have purchased has lasted for 5-10 yrs at our other accounts. Works great while it lasted, debating to buy another one. It was handy while it worked, but paying $140 or so every 2 years won't be worth it...
customer_reviews.author: P. Ogawa

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this label maker
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this label maker! You can put any two size labels in it you want. I use one side for postage stamps and the other for labels. This is the only brand (DYMO) that I found that works for the MAC, it comes with a free subscription to the basic postage stamp service. I had one before and after ??? YEARS of HEAVY use it finally broke so I bought a new one. Again, it works perfectly! I can easily switch out the labels and put different sizes in it.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Decker

customer_reviews.title: Failed in 95 days.
customer_reviews.text: The printer worked fine for about 3 months, then it printed test patterns for about 200 labels. I was able to get it out of "test" mode then and it worked for a single batch of labels. Now the left side is dead and the right side runs endlessly. Buy a Brother, and when doing so get a wireless model.
customer_reviews.author: Avg Joe

customer_reviews.title: It's been 4 years and running like new
customer_reviews.text: I got this label printer 4 years ago mainly for postcard labels. Yesterday my daughter asked me if I could create labels for her school folders. She was amazed and mesmerized with this little printer.
customer_reviews.author: NYC-Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Buy New!!  This One Was DOA!!
customer_reviews.text: Received DOA!! This was a returned item which was rated "Very Good". Also, it was shown as being checked out by a tech, I suppose. Labels wrapped around the feed spool and would not work. After removing this jam it would not align or print labels correctly. The print was off center and very light. Don't buy used. I use this label maker at work everyday and it works great. Buy new not refurb!!
customer_reviews.author: Night Nemesis

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT, YOU WON'T REGRET IT!
customer_reviews.text: The DYMO Label Writer 450 Twin Turbo prints great labels along with accurate postage. Granted the labels are not archival (nor were they meant to be), but they are truly professional looking. After I signed up for a year's subscription (Mac version) at Endicia, the inside sales rep Mike called me next week and included an additional 90 days to my 30 day free trial! I would suggest for future improvements: an on/off switch; a way to adjust the "sleep" mode; and as previous reviewers have noted, a WiFi model.
customer_reviews.author: Eric L. Hoover

customer_reviews.title: They are no longer affiliated with (Endicia).
customer_reviews.text: DYMO is a likable brained I just had a problem with the company’s affiliate program Endicia is no longer a registered company with them and I do a lot of business with them so all the items I have perched are pointless to have since DYMO is not longer affiliated and has not been for sometime now, so I have decided not to keep the DYMO and return it as soon as I was told two day latter that they had not been doing business with DYMO.
customer_reviews.author: MASON H. ROSS, JR

customer_reviews.title: Equipment useless because open a Dymo Account
customer_reviews.text: I set up this product when I tried to register for an online account (required to use Dymo Stamps), there was an error, and I could not create an account or reset password. I've tried calling technical support and customer support on at least different days in the last couple weeks. After 30 minutes of hold everytime, I've just hung up. Returning this product. It doesn't matter how good the product is, if you're customer support / tech support is this outrageously bad, it becomes junk.
customer_reviews.author: Boo McCoo

customer_reviews.title: I "replaced" a single roll 450 turbo that died in the Sonoma County Firestorm
customer_reviews.text: No more having to get up from my chair, maneuver past all the other stuff on my desk, just to print a few stamps because with the single-roll printer I had to open up the thermal printer, pull out the address label stock that's my default and replace it with the postage stock. The printer is very good at figuring out which roll to use, very quick, and not noisy. What's not to like?
customer_reviews.author: J. Robertson

customer_reviews.title: software is a joke and so is customer service.
customer_reviews.text: the software does not update address anymore Endicia owns that software is no longer is affiliated with DYMO. Need to find another printer. also, print losses connection often and you need to unplug and plug back in for it to work again. I got used to that. so in the end I am looking for a printer that has the same capabilities without all the issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... Label Writer 450 for a long time and have loved it, with the 450 Twin
customer_reviews.text: I have had a DYMO Label Writer 450 for a long time and have loved it, with the 450 Twin, I can print different labels without changing the roll. I have been able to print my own postage and address labels in no time. I love, love, love this printer. I have a Mac, also and it works great with it. Also, I had a little problem setting it up and I called their Customer Service line and they were really helpful got me fixed up right away.
customer_reviews.author: Den Girl

customer_reviews.title: Nice printer -- but needs an on/off switch
customer_reviews.text: Nice, convenient printer, somewhat eccentric software. Not intuitive networking. Use the brand labels -- off-brand can jam. And you'll occasionally have the machine jam -- despite your best practices. The printer really needs an off/on switch for these times, rather than have the labels continue to jam while you fumble with the power cord on the rear of the device.
customer_reviews.author: K. H. Library

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, you can load two type on labels
customer_reviews.text: Dymo label Writer 450 Twin, two printers in one. Great idea, you can load two type on labels, and print the one that you need. The problem is that the software looks at it as one printer and you need to choose the left or the right one. It remembers the one that you used last time, and you waste labels as you print to the wrong side. Also you must change the type of the label when switching. Smart software would memorize the type of label in each side, and show it as two separate printers. Bottom line it take twice the space on your desk, and you end up using one side only.
customer_reviews.author: ED

customer_reviews.title: Nice little units
customer_reviews.text: Got this one to replace one which lost its mind after a power failure. After the new one put in place, the old one recovered its sanity so now it sits where i can hook the laptop to it as needed. These printers are fast, very handy for cranking out labels in short time, using the Dymo Label Software. Utility and convenience, what's not to like.
customer_reviews.author: AMAZON PURCHASER

customer_reviews.title: Great but not for ebay and paypal labels!
customer_reviews.text: First off, this is a great label printer. very fast and high quality! If you're in the market for a label printer for printing labels from ebay or paypal, you will need a wider label or you will suffer by having to print screen labels and shrinking them to fit on the larger label. I'm dealing for now until my regular printer is hooked up. Overall, it's a great label printer to have for anyone that owns a small business that requires fast labels. You can add your logo to labels making your business look even more professional.
customer_reviews.author: Buffy

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUT THIS!!!
customer_reviews.text: The labels are so small SERIOUSLY Im telling you not even Barbie or Ken could read the label printed out of this. I bought this for my husbands business. So he could print consistent professional labels. ITS UNBELIEVABLE HOW MISLEADING THIS IS. COMPLETELY USELESS. The print is way to small for anyone to see let alone read.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Disconnects a lot
customer_reviews.text: This printer is difficult. It seems to disconnect a great deal, and then it is difficult to reconnect. I have had to uninstall and reinstall this printer a few times in the year that I have owned it. I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: The Salbertsons

customer_reviews.title: OCD and Can't Be Without One!
customer_reviews.text: I can't live without my labeler! I purchase these for every office I set up professionally and also have one for home use. If you get within arm's-length of me, I'll slap a label on you. I have the neatest files around and love the memory and mailing options, etc. Fabulous product and every client of mine has returned to his/her office and has been thrilled with the result and convenience.
customer_reviews.author: Tuff Tex

customer_reviews.title: Great Price - So Handy!
customer_reviews.text: This Dymo label maker is so handy - it was a great price and shipped very fast. My only criticism is I wish when I changed from side to side that it would remember the size of label I have and automatically switch the design to the larger label. Other than that, AWESOME product!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: This is very useful and quality taps machine
customer_reviews.text: This is very useful for office and documents collection so clear and easy to finding my staffs. Good quality and strong have two papers comes out put on different files,very useful and beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: Value customers

customer_reviews.title: Great for business needs.
customer_reviews.text: Works fantastic for all my printing needs including good for FBA related business but wish it had the wide XL and the thinner feed in one. Great price.
customer_reviews.author: Recruiting Experts

customer_reviews.title: Better than stamps.com
customer_reviews.text: I use this to print stamps and labels for notebooks. This is cheaper than stamps.com. If you use Endicia stamps, you don’t have to pay a monthly fee. This will pay for itself in only a few months. Also, it is easier to peel stamps off the roll than it is to peel them off the Stamps.com stamp sheets.
customer_reviews.author: B. Pearce

customer_reviews.title: Best label printer out there
customer_reviews.text: I needed a quality label printer to make up some price tags and return labels that I needed to use. The printer is so easy to use, and you can print two labels at a time, instead of changing label styles. This compact printer uses no ink! I love that feature! It quickly prints crisp, smear-proof labels. It can print many different labels - even postage labels, which I look forward to using. I love the price tags. They fold over and securely and stay put- they cannot be pulled or ripped off. You can upload your logo and print it on the labels. This printer is not cheap, but definitely nice quality and worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Love the printer
customer_reviews.text: Love the printer. We needed to print two different labels and didn't want to have to swap between labels throughout the day. This was easy to install and setup the address label template for quick access. We already own a single label printer, which worked so well, we ordered this double printer too. I would definitely get another one if the need arises.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine77

customer_reviews.title: Software a step down from older versions.
customer_reviews.text: I actually didn't want to upgrade because of the Dymo connect software. I'm learning it, but it isn't as intuitive. The software slows me down but I love that I don't have to constantly change label rolls.
customer_reviews.author: Marianne

customer_reviews.title: Great Price!!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for our kids check-in. The dual roll feature allows labels to continue to be printed with minimal interruption. When one roll runs out, the printer switches over to the other roll automatically. We are very happy with this printer. The price is great and at the time I checked, it beat Best Buy and Office Max.
customer_reviews.author: RW

customer_reviews.title: This printer works just great with my dymo account program
customer_reviews.text: This printer works just great with my dymo account program. I use it to print postage stamps for my small business and for shipping labels. I have never used a label printer before but i really like the fact that I dont have to use ink for this printer, it uses thermal printing. This label printer has helped me a lot with my small business and my shipping needs. It plugs into my computer via USB cable to my laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Canales

customer_reviews.title: Dymo Stamps no longer works
customer_reviews.text: Only basic postage (like stamps) can be printed with this device now that Dymo Stamps is no longer working. Before you could print postage for packages and priority mail envelopes. Since Endicia switched to the Netstamp, only basic postage can be printed with this printer. Just stock up on regular stamps and save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Liu

customer_reviews.title: The software on this product is garbage. I have not been able to use this ...
customer_reviews.text: The software on this product is garbage. I have not been able to use this product for more than a few minutes at a time before it starts to give me all sorts of error messages. Now, I cannot use it at all because once I open the program, the error messages start to pop up and don't quit. The machine itself works well once the software works but the software does not work often enough to redeem that. I have contacted DYMO support several times for trouble-shooting. I wish I could return this product.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Byer

customer_reviews.title: Works great for selling on Amazon Bar Coding and labeling products
customer_reviews.text: It took calling Dymo support to discover how to use the software for correct functionality of their products. Now it works perfectly and I love using it. Have already gone through a complete roll of labels in just a week. Wow.. it keeps going and I recommend using it for Amazon labeling and barcoding.
customer_reviews.author: Apollo's

customer_reviews.title: half a deal
customer_reviews.text: rats. I came back after 6 months to find out DYMO & stamps.com now want $17.99 per month just for licensing before I print anything. the labels are great but I bought this when there was no monthly charge. they change I change. as a real estate broker I can just use basic USPS stamps and save $200 a year
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Makes my mail look a lot more professional and I like the bar code for machine readability
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. I use the right side for to (address labels) and left for from (return labels). Makes my mail look a lot more professional and I like the bar code for machine readability. Software allows you to place bar code top or bottom for address labels and is easy enough to use. Software provides quick (1-2 click) access to frequently used predesigned labels. This should be used with the same labels. Trying to swap them out for different jobs isn't that easy. These labels are not permanent.
customer_reviews.author: Shoebuddy Jones, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Dont know how it prints yet
customer_reviews.text: Tried printing out 3 different QR codes and now the whole roll of labels are gone, just kept going and had to unplug it so it would stop.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: I hate this printer!!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing absolutely sucks! I spend more time troubleshooting than actually printing labels. Their software is horrible. The USB cable is not even recognized by my computer. Has to be the worse purchase I've made period. Absolute trash.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: Item as described and works great, I did not need the dual printing, but it was only are few dollars more so I figured, plan for the future, or duel printing on large volumes. I had purchased one before for my work, and it is nice to have one now for my own personal/business use.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Jones

customer_reviews.title: Broken after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: The left printer was broken from the get go. Spitting out extra labels. It started jamming and than broke all togther. Good luck reaching Dymo support for warranty or anything. 3 hours on the phone and no one. no one will answer chat, no one will answer emails. No support what so ever. Avoid them like the plague.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Moon

customer_reviews.title: Every Executive Assistant needs this label maker
customer_reviews.text: Love this machine! I needed two types of labels and was wasting too many to change out. This is the perfect solution. Easy to pick which label to print. Well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: K. Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Makes Good Labels
customer_reviews.text: Had another prior so bought again. Like that it worked right out of box but it deleted all the labels I already had.
customer_reviews.author: TopCop

customer_reviews.title: Had to return
customer_reviews.text: The printer looks like it does two different sizes of labels and that’s what the picture depicts however it is not like that at all. Please make your picture show accurate stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Allysa

customer_reviews.title: Fast printer and works fine with aftermarket labels
customer_reviews.text: I use this printer for printing barcodes and occasionally mailing labels. I rarely have issues with jamming unlike some of the other reviewers. It did however take a bit of time to learn how to troubleshoot in the beginning.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Very hard to use if possible!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I never caught this piece of crapp. I went on line and tried t download the software confusing as he'll. I will never buy a dymo product like this again! Avery here I come..
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful for those who print a lot of labels
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Hanging File folder and the File Folder labels. I love it so much. It's somewhat costly, but I was print out 30 different labels in a minute. Where it would have taken 15 to 20 minutes, to hand type them into the basic label maker keyboard. If you have a home office and print labels on a regular basis, it's worth the cost. Plus there are many more types of labels you can print out, include return address labels/shipping labels and stamps.
customer_reviews.author: RB Tucson, AZ

customer_reviews.title: Malfunctions sometimes
customer_reviews.text: The printer works great most of the time and I have been able to save a reasonable amount of time with this label printing instead of purchasing labels elsewhere. Unfortunately this malfunctions sometimes and prints gets distorted or rarely label is crushed. For the wasted labels, the cost of doing this at home does not save you anything. Its just convenience that makes this worth buying
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: It is so easy to install and use
customer_reviews.text: The DYMO Label Writer 450 Twin Turbo is the most used piece of office equipment I have on my desk besides my computer. I use this label writer for everything. It is so easy to install and use. I can change out the different types of label rolls in a flash. I use the large shipping labels and mailing labels every single day. I use the small labels for file folders and other identifiers throughout the office. I ended up buying a Twin Turbo for everyone on my team so that every could have access right at their desk. Best office investment ever!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy G

customer_reviews.title: Great product, Great performer!
customer_reviews.text: We have read some mixed reviews on this product from Dymo, but have had nothing but success with it to date. A few small hiccups (maybe two in a year or so) that required an unplugging, waiting for the unit to completely power down, and plugging back in. Its way handy to print both labels and postage from the applications and makes for no more standing in line at the Post Office! This is a must-have for a small business owner fulfilling orders on a regular basis.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle M.

customer_reviews.title: Lables for a business
customer_reviews.text: If you're running a business and print labels, purchase this. I had the dymo that only printed the shipping lable size. I had to always open Microsoft word to print just the lable address without the return address. No more the old way. And the after market purchased lables, especially the colored ones work just as good as dymo lables. Don't let them fool you when they say only use their lables.
customer_reviews.author: billy t edwards jr

customer_reviews.title: The motor died in 3 mos.
customer_reviews.text: No return or support at this point so $43 dollars a month for use. I have the other models that have lasted a couple years so maybe this was just a fluke. I have ordered another of the 450 twin turbo.. so this will get updated if it too fails in an unreasonable timeframe. No news is good news... Start date for #2 unit will be 2/1/19. Hoping for better results!
customer_reviews.author: Joan M.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent machine
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this label maker for about 8 months now and absolutely love it. I have stamps on one side and file folder labels on the other, so it is in constant use. The efficiency and convenience of the printer and particularly the stamps have been a godsend in my busy office. One important thing to note is that it is CRITICAL to use the label guides to keep the label strip tight up against the side of the unit. If you don't, multiple labels may come out of the machine, leading to waste.
customer_reviews.author: Mona Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Best thing ever
customer_reviews.text: I need to print stamps on a regular basis, and I need to print labels on a regular basis. Who wants to switch out label rolls every day? Not me! Since this printer can handle two rolls, my printer is always stocked with the label I need to print. Well worth the extra money to get the dual-label-roll feature. The software that comes with it is easy to use to design and print labels. It works great with the Dymo stamp printing software too. (And the stamps program is the best price I could find for printing postage at my desk.) Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: TennesseeBuyer

customer_reviews.title: DYMO Label printer
customer_reviews.text: I run a small home-based business. This label printer was more than what I needed. I returned the product before using it. If you have a business that requires you to ship products every day, this may be the product for your business!
customer_reviews.author: Amy J.

customer_reviews.title: I received package on time. I have yet been ...
customer_reviews.text: I received package on time. I have yet been able to use it. The cd for installation included is defective. It appears to be brand new, but will not read in any pc or laptop I try. There was a power cord included however there wasn't a usb cord. I will track down a usb cord and will try to find another cd online or maybe try online installation. It is a bit of a hassle. However if I am successful I will upgrade the review.
customer_reviews.author: Sahkneeyou

customer_reviews.title: Sad but not giving up yet
customer_reviews.text: I have used Dymo LabelWriters for years but this one has been a disappointment due to lag of about 10 seconds between each label including the first one printed. I've also noticed that when the printing is done I have to wait again for the label to move forward to allow the clean tear via perforation. I have tried plugging the printer directly into a wall outlet, multiple USB ports, a different USB cable and power cycling without any luck. Update: as of today no lag and running great!
customer_reviews.author: Brad Stone

customer_reviews.title: Makes life easy
customer_reviews.text: I use this to label my cabnets and I use it at the day care center , it works great for mail labels
customer_reviews.author: Lolo

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works so well. Very user friendly. Anytime I need to add labels in or change labels it’s so easy. It’s also very nice that you can have two different sizes to use.
customer_reviews.author: Lseog

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love this little label maker. Since typewriters have gone away and changing the paper out of my printer to put in one envelope is a time waster, I love pulling up the program that stays in my tray, type in what I want on the label and hit the print button. It is so fast and easy. I took it to work because I will use it more there, but will buy another one soon for home. I haven't learned how to make it function within WORD, but no big deal. It is just too easy to use by itself.
customer_reviews.author: MGrier

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT PURCHASE!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best items I have purchased for my business! I make many different batches of small products and often only need 50 labels or less. I can quickly design a label, run test prints and apply to products in less than an hour!
customer_reviews.author: Cecile's Bath & Body

customer_reviews.title: Stamp Side Malfunctioned.
customer_reviews.text: The label side works fine, but the stamp side was a nightmare for me. The very FIRST time I tried to use it, the stamp unraveled inside the machine and got stuck, rendering it (and the remaining stamps) useless as it would not feed any more stamps through. I tried calling Endicia for customer support, but was stuck on hold for over 30 minutes before they hung up on me. I contacted live chat, who just told me to call it in. Amazon, however, ended up helping me out. No help from Endicia!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon User

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this! So much easier than trying to print from sheets on your printer especially when printing one-off labels. High quality labels efficiently created.
customer_reviews.author: OrangeCowboy

product_meta.title: DYMO Label Writer 450 Twin Turbo label printer, 71 Labels Per Minute, Black/Silver (1752266)
product_meta.description: The DYMO LabelWriter 450 Twin Turbo features two rolls of labels ready to print at all times – enhancing efficiency by allowing you to print address labels and postage without swapping label rolls – and prints up to 71 four-line standard address labels per minute for maximum productivity. Create and print address, shipping, file folder, and barcode labels, plus name badges, and more – all without the extra work and hassle of printing sheet labels on a standard desktop printer. Compatible with Windows 7 or later and Mac OS X v10.8 or later. Microsoft and Windows are either registered trademarks or trademarks of Microsoft Corporation in the United States and/or other countries. Mac and OS X are trademarks of Apple Inc., registered in the U.S. and other countries.
feature_bullets: Thermal printing technology eliminates the need for expensive ink or toner. Prints up to 71 four line standard address labels per minute for maximum productivity. Compatible with Windows 7 or later and Mac OS X v10.8 or later
Customize and Print address, file folder and barcode labels, Plus Name badges and more with DYMO label software all from your PC or Mac
Save time by creating labels directly from text in Microsoft word, Excel, outlook, QuickBooks and other programs or easily Print addresses from outlook contacts or Mac address book.
Print crystal clear barcodes, labels and graphics with 600 x 300 dpi resolution

Eliminate the waste and hassle of sheet labels Print precise quantities without difficulty. Print USPS approved DYMO Stamps postage directly from your desktop no monthly fee, contracts or commitments required

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars1,075 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
